meanings.definition: Not awake or aware of one's surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The patient remained unconscious after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: She lay unconscious on the floor after fainting.
meanings.sent3: He was so deep in sleep that he seemed unconscious to the world.
meanings.sent4: The city was unconscious of the impending storm brewing in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave made him feel unconscious of time passing.

meanings.sent1: She acted unconsciously, not realizing the impact of her words.
meanings.sent2: He walked unconsciously, lost in his thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The robot moved unconsciously, following its programmed instructions.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass unconsciously as they chatted away.
meanings.sent5: The music played softly in the background, almost unconsciously noticed.

meanings.sent1: He was unconscious of the danger lurking behind him.
meanings.sent2: The child was unconscious of the mischief he had caused.
meanings.sent3: She remained unconscious of the surprise party being planned for her.
meanings.sent4: The cat seemed unconscious of the chaos it had caused in the room.
meanings.sent5: The student was unconscious of the correct answer to the question.
